intro: Hieracium pseudelongatum, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, making it a common sight in certain regions.
